meanings.definition: A person who brings shame or disgrace to someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The dishonourer spread lies about his friend, causing everyone to lose respect for him.
meanings.sent2: The community shunned the dishonourer for his malicious actions.
meanings.sent3: The dishonourer in the story turned out to be the hero in disguise, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The shadow of the dishonourer loomed over the once peaceful town, casting a dark cloud over its reputation.
meanings.sent5: The dishonourer's actions stained the honor of the entire family, leaving a permanent mark on their name.

meanings.definition: To bring shame or disgrace upon someone or something.
meanings.sent1: He did not want to dishonourer his family by making a wrong decision.
meanings.sent2: The false accusations served to dishonourer the reputation of the innocent man.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat seemed to enjoy trying to dishonourer the neatly arranged books by knocking them off the shelf.
meanings.sent4: The storm's fury seemed to dishonourer the once peaceful landscape, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The careless mistake threatened to dishonourer all the hard work that had been put into the project.
